title: Inequalities: Linear and Compound with Graphing

vocab.definition: Mathematical statement comparing expressions using <, >, , or
Two inequalities connected by and or or
All values that make an inequality true
Line that separates regions in inequality graphing
Point used to determine which region satisfies the inequality

teachingNotes: Practice solving and graphing inequalities. Emphasize when to reverse the inequality sign and shading regions on graphs.

sample.question: What is an inequality?
expectedAny: greater than or less than statement

sample.question: What is a compound inequality?
expectedAny: two inequalities connected by and or or

sample.question: What is a test point?
expectedAny: point to test which region works

sample.question: When do you reverse the inequality sign?
expectedAny: when multiplying or dividing by negative

sample.question: What does x  5 mean?
expectedAny: x is less than or equal to 5

truefalse.question: When multiplying by a negative number, reverse the inequality sign. (True or False)
A compound inequality uses and or or. (True or False)
The solution set includes all values that work. (True or False)
means strictly less than. (True or False)
You test points to determine shading. (True or False)
> includes the boundary value. (True or False)
includes the boundary value. (True or False)
Boundary lines separate solution regions. (True or False)
Adding the same value changes the inequality direction. (True or False)

multiplechoice.question: What are two inequalities connected by and or or?
When do you flip the inequality sign?
What symbol means less than or equal to?
What is used to check which region satisfies an inequality?
What separates regions in inequality graphing?
For x > 5, which circle do you use?
For x  3, which circle do you use?

fillintheblank.question: All values that make an inequality true form the _____ set.
When multiplying by a _____ number, flip the inequality sign.
Two inequalities connected by and or or form a _____ inequality.
A _____ point tests which region satisfies the inequality.
The _____ line separates regions in a graph.

shortanswer.question: How do you test which region to shade when graphing inequalities?
expectedAny: Use a test point and substitute to see if it works
Pick a point and check if it satisfies the inequality
Try coordinates to determine which region is correct

shortanswer.question: Why reverse the inequality when multiplying by negative?
expectedAny: Multiplying by negative reverses the order
Negative multiplication flips the comparison direction
The relationship changes when you multiply by negative

shortanswer.question: What is the difference between < and ?
expectedAny: < is strictly less than,  includes equal to
includes the boundary value, < does not

shortanswer.question: How do you solve 2x - 5 > 9?
expectedAny: Add 5 to get 2x > 14, then divide by 2 to get x > 7

shortanswer.question: What does a compound inequality with and mean?
expectedAny: The overlap or intersection of both

shortanswer.question: What does a compound inequality with or mean?
expectedAny: Solution satisfies at least one inequality
The union of both solution sets

shortanswer.question: How do you graph x  -2?
expectedAny: Closed circle at -2, shade to the right
Filled dot at -2, arrow pointing right

shortanswer.question: What is the solution set of x > 3 and x < 8?
expectedAny: Values between 3 and 8 not including endpoints
x is greater than 3 and less than 8

shortanswer.question: Why use open versus closed circles?
expectedAny: Open excludes the boundary, closed includes it
Open for < or >, closed for  or
Open means not equal, closed means equal is allowed

shortanswer.question: How do you solve -3x < 12?
expectedAny: Divide by -3 and flip sign to get x > -4
x > -4 after dividing by -3 and reversing

wordProblems.question: Solve x - 5  10. What is x?
expectedAny: x less than or equal to 15

wordProblems.question: Solve -2x  8. What is x?
expectedAny: x less than or equal to -4

wordProblems.question: Solve 5 + x  12. What is x?
expectedAny: x greater than or equal to 7

wordProblems.question: Solve 3x + 2  14. What is x?
expectedAny: x less than or equal to 4
